english_translation: Narrated by Qatadah: Abdullah ibn Masud used to say, when he wanted to enter a city: 'O Allah, Lord of the heavens and all they overshadow, Lord of the earth and all it carries, Lord of the devils and all they lead astray, Lord of the winds and all they scatter, I ask You for its good and the good that is in it, and I seek refuge in You from its evil and the evil that is in it.'

english_translation: Narrated by al-Zuhri, from Ibrahim ibn Abd al-Rahman ibn Awf: A man from the people of Sham came to Madinah and met the companions of the Prophet ﷺ and greeted them. Abd al-Rahman ibn Awf was away working in his land at al-Jurf. The man went to him and found him with his cloak off, a hoe in his hand, directing water in his land. When Abd al-Rahman ibn Awf saw him, he removed the hoe from his hand and put on his cloak. The man said: 'I came for one reason but saw something more amazing than it. What is it that we are quick in jihad and you are slow in it? We abstain from the world while you desire it? Yet you are our predecessors and the companions of our Prophet!' Abd al-Rahman ibn Awf said: 'We do not know except what you know, nor has come to us except what came to you. But we were tested with hardship and we were patient, and we were tested with ease yet we were not patient.'
